column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Sigmund Freud
#Text=Did Judeo-Christian outlook infuse any of Freud 's thinking , like it did Michel Foucalt in the The History of Sexuality ?
#Text=Freud was somewhat of a maverick in that regard , because his position really went against what a lot of other people were saying .
#Text=Freud maintained that bisexuality was a normal part of development .

#Text=That all of us went through a period of bisexuality and that , in the end , most of us came out heterosexual but that the bisexual phase we traversed remained on some unconscious level , and was dealt with in other ways .
#Text=For instance , friendship , chumships , and ' greater glory of the love of mankind ' kinds of sentiments .
#Text=Freud felt these had their basis in this constitutional bisexuality that all individuals had .
#Text=He did not consider it something that should be criminalized , or penalized —
#Text=— but treated ?
#Text=— treated if it presented a problem for the individual .
#Text=Freud felt there were a number of homosexuals he encountered who did not have a variety of complex problems that homosexuality was a part of .
#Text=He found people who were totally normal in every other regard except in terms of their sexual preference .
#Text=In fact , he saw many of them as having higher intellects , higher aesthetic sensibilities , higher morals ; those kinds of things .
#Text=He did not see it as something to criminalize or penalize , or to keep from psychoanalytic training .
#Text=A lot of the psychoanalytic institutes felt if you were homosexual you should not be accepted ; that was not Freud 's position .
#Text=How did he discern whether a person 's homosexuality was a problem with the person internally , or whether it was an external problem brought about by societal reaction to the individual ?
#Text=Freud would use the technique of analysis to figure that out , and work with that individual to explore the cause .

#Text=In his later theories he would look at whether this is an oedipal issue , whether he wanted to be with the mother and could n't have the mother so he then wanted to have men , so that men could would like him , and then he would get the affection of the mother object .
#Text=He would explore the issues that way .
#Text=He would not start from the bias that this is the individual 's problem that needed to be fixed .
#Text=Is his model of psychosexual development model outdated as to be useless , or is it still functioning ?
#Text=I think you used the operative word .
#Text=It 's a model .
#Text=What we try to do as therapists is come up with a hypothesis that works for the individual that he can use to help him or herself , as opposed to having my theory inflicted upon you .
#Text=If you can use a psychosexual development kind of model in helping to understand what the situation is , it can be a language that the two of us can speak .
#Text=Most therapists are focusing less on even using that as language .
#Text=It 's more of a concept to structure something .
